GameController
GameController Class
Controls a specific Game GameModel by allowing a player to perform all actions that can be executed in a game The class can add, remove, reconnect and disconnects players to the game and let players grab and position tiles from the playground to the shelf.
GameControllerInterface
This interface contains all the action a player can do in a single game
GameControllerTest
 
GameEndedController
 
GameEndedException
 
GameFlow
GameFlow class
As a workaround to the different GUI and TUI implementations, we created this class
The TUI obviously has a different pace in the game that the GUI, as the TUI is more linear
-> Only one action can be performed at any point in time,
where the GUi is more complex, a message can be sent while the tiles are being picked up, and so on
We opted for this class hat sets the pace of the game to be the same for both TUI and GUI.
we have two additional threads that help us do so: InputReader and InputParser.
GameFlow is directly connected to InputParser, which creates InputReader.
InputReader reads from the input (in TUI) or matches any action performed by the client as a TUI input (in GUI)
For example, if the player was to click on a tile in the GUI's playground, it would register the click as three inputs in TUI (row, column and direction)
Then adds the data read to a buffer queue.

InputParser then pops entries from this queue and parses them, to understand what each means.
If he understands that the player wanted to send a message, the message is created and sent,
if not, the data is sent to the gameFlow, which will then perform an action accordingly (pick up tiles, place tiles, ecc)
GameListener
This interface is used to notify the client about the changes in the game
GameListenersHandlerClient
 
GameListenersHandlerSocket
This class is used to pass the GameListener to the client via socket GameListener It has a private ObjectOutputStream where it writes the data
GameModel
 
GameModelImmutable
A different implementation of the GameModel class, this is the one we send to the clients
As such, we need to make all the objects in this class immutable, so that the clients
cannot modify the course of the game.

To do so, a strategy patter was implemented.
The pattern consists of implementing for each mutable object two different interfaces,
one for the server, one for the client.
The server one has no changes from the class it's implemented by
the client one, on the other hand, only has getter methods, named differently that the server one,
so that the client can only get the object, and doesn't know the names of the setter methods

MainController
MainController Class
Is the Controller of the controllers, it manages all the available games that are running GameController
Allowing players to create, join, reconnect, leave and delete games
Therefore, the MainController is unique across the app and thus implements the Singleton Pattern
MainControllerInterface
This interface contains the events regarding the list of games

Player
Player's class
A player has a nickname, his shelf, a secretGoal,
the tiles he has in hand (inHandTile), the points he obtained
all the listeners needed for the network, a flag that indicates if he's ready to start
and a flag that indicates whether he's connected to the server or not
